column4: I changed my IP address so I can ping my router now, but I still can't connect to sites for some reason
How can I get the value that the "gateway" should be set to for manual IPv4?
What is your /etc/resolv.conf have in it for dns?
route
also see "route -n"
route just gives me the gateway I assigned manually
but I can't connect to any sites. I can only ping myself and my router
can you post what your /etc/resolv.conf file has in it for DNS servers?
do a "cat /etc/resolv.conf" and let me know what's in it.
/etc/resolve.conf has nameserver 4.2.2.5
change that to your router ip which should handle dns for you.
I changed the DNS server to my router's ip and it's still not working
can you pastebin your ifconfig and "cat /etc/resolv.conf" output. I assume your chatting through the same internet connection that your attempting to run this on?
Can't pastebin, I'm on a separate computer
I guess you can't type it?
What's in your routing table?
I can type it. it will take a bit. is there any specific part of the output I should type?
no what you gave is fine that's what I wanted to see.
Just curious what is the ip address, subnet, and gateway of the computer your chatting with currently?
bingo
Did you try "dhclient" from the command line?
I'll try that.
dhclient doesn't fix it either
